page.title: 06St. Mary's Church Shawbury.
page.content: {The parish church of St.Mary the {Virgin}was built by the Normans in the early 12th century using stone from {Grinshill quarry. We read in the Domesday book that there was a church and a{priest}in Shawbury and we believe the present church was built on the same site.This site is in the centre of the village. The church is in the{diocese of {Lichfield. Later in the 14th century a new chancel was built and a new tower at the west end.Not long ago the church bells were restored after being left for 50 years. In 1985 there is one priest and a deacon.On Sundays at 8.00am the celebration of the holy{Eucharist} takes place and a sung Eucharist is at 11.00am.
